Classic chocolate chip cookies

These classic chocolate chip cookies are a favorite for any occasion. They're easy to make, and the end result is a soft, chewy cookie with just the right amount of sweetness. The recipe starts with a simple mix of flour, baking soda, and salt, which gets combined with a creamy mixture of butter, white and brown sugars, eggs, and vanilla extract. Finally, the chocolate chips are folded in, creating a delicious cookie dough that is perfect for baking. Once the cookies come out of the oven, they're golden brown and chewy, with melty chocolate chips in every bite. Serve them warm with a glass of milk, or enjoy them as a sweet snack any time of day!

favorite45

thumb_down10

Ingredients

  • 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
  • 3/4 cup white granulated sugar
  • 3/4 cup light brown sugar, packed
  • 2 large eggs
  • 2 tsp vanilla extract
  • 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips

Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

  2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.

  3. In a large mixing bowl, use an electric mixer to cream the butter, white granulated sugar, and light brown sugar together until light and fluffy, about 2-3 minutes.

  4. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until fully incorporated. Stir in the vanilla extract.

  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.

  6. Stir in the chocolate chips until evenly distributed throughout the dough.

  7. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.

  8. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the centers are set.

  9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
